metadata.feature_description: Set content as master template for reuse across multiple module instances

steps.action: Navigate to Home page and enable Edit mode
steps.expected: Edit mode enabled with module action menus visible
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled successfully with all modules showing Actions links

steps.action: Click on Admin menu for HTML module (Home Banner - module 362)
steps.expected: Module actions menu should contain 'Make Master' option
steps.actual: Module actions menu shows: Settings, Export Content, Import Content, Help, Develop, Delete, Refresh. No 'Make Master' option visible.

steps.action: Open Module Settings to check for Make Master option
steps.expected: Settings dialog should contain Make Master functionality
steps.actual: Module Settings dialog does not contain Make Master option. The feature only appears as a contextual warning message for orphaned shared modules.

issues: The 'Make Master' feature is NOT accessible as a standard menu item in Module Actions. Based on code review (HtmlModule.ascx.cs lines 197-216, 278-285), the feature only appears as a warning message link when a shared module is 'orphaned' - meaning the module was added to another page via 'Add Existing Module' and its original master page was deleted. Without an orphaned shared module scenario, the 'Make Master' option cannot be tested via the UI.

observations: Code review reveals 'Make Master' is a conditional feature in HtmlTextProController.cs (MakeMaster method at line 93) that only appears for orphaned shared modules
The feature is triggered via MakeMasterPage.js which adds click behavior to a link with class 'makeMasterPage{ModuleId}'
The warning message 'This module does not belong to the page, but its master page is not found. Make this page as master?' is displayed via ShowMakeMasterMessage() in HtmlModule.ascx.cs

To test this feature properly, one would need to: 1) Create a shared module via 'Add Existing Module', 2) Delete the original master page, 3) Then the Make Master link would appear on the orphaned module
All modules on the current pages are NOT orphaned shared modules, so the Make Master link is not visible in the UI
The feature description 'Module Actions > Make Master' is misleading - it's not a standard module action but a contextual message for error recovery
